meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from ethyl alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The ethylic smell of the disinfectant filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The ethylic content of the drink was clearly noticeable.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her perfume had an ethylic kick to it.
meanings.sent4: The ethylic essence of the brewery wafted through the air.
meanings.sent5: The ethylic nature of the solution made it effective against germs.

meanings.sent1: The ethylic solution was used for cleaning purposes.
meanings.sent2: The ethylic beverage was enjoyed by many at the party.
meanings.sent3: He found the ethylic taste of the medicine surprisingly pleasant.
meanings.sent4: The ethylic content of the perfume lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The ethylic properties of the hand sanitizer made it effective.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the ethyl radical.
meanings.sent1: The ethylic compound was studied in the chemistry lab.
meanings.sent2: The ethylic group in the molecule was highlighted in the diagram.
meanings.sent3: The ethylic structure of the molecule fascinated the students.
meanings.sent4: The ethylic bond in the chemical reaction was crucial.
meanings.sent5: The ethylic properties of the substance were analyzed by the researchers.
